title: Margin Zones
content:
This indicator allows you to automatically calculate and visualize margin zones to the specified parameters. Margin Zone Level = Margin / Price Tick.

Calculation:
Margin Zone Level = Margin / Price Tick.
For example, take the euro futures, the ticker 6E.
Margin = $ 2300
Tick price = $ 6.25
Marginal zone level = 2300 / 6.25 = 368 ticks. This means that the margin zone will be built at a distance of 368 ticks from the initial price. The height of the marginal zone is 10% of this distance, that is, 36 ticks.

To add and set up the indicator, open the Indicators settings window.


Indicator's settings

Settings

NameDescription
Margin Margin values for the instrument can be viewed on the exchange.
Tick cost Tick cost values for the instrument can be viewed on the exchange.
Zone width (days) Refers to the number of previous days taken into account when calculating an indicator.
Custom price If enabled, determines the starting price level set by the user, otherwise it is determined automatically.
